tool.name: expression
tool.command:
chakin expression add_expression '$organism_id' '$analysis_id' '$file_path'
#if $separator: --separator '$separator' #end if #if $unit: --unit '$unit' #end if #if $query_type: --query_type '$query_type' #end if #if $match_on_name: $match_on_name #end if #if $re_name: --re_name '$re_name' #end if #if $skip_missing: $skip_missing #end if
| jq -S . > $results

param.name: organism_id
param.label: Organism Id
param.help: The id of the associated organism

param.name: analysis_id
param.label: Analysis Id
param.help: The id of the associated analysis

param.name: separator
param.label: Separator
param.help: Separating character in the matrix file (ex : ','). Default character is tab.

param.name: unit
param.label: Unit
param.help: The units associated with the loaded values (ie, FPKM, RPKM, raw counts)

param.name: query_type
param.label: Query Type
param.help: The feature type (e.g. 'gene', 'mRNA', 'polypeptide', 'contig') of the query. It must be a valid Sequence Ontology term.

param.name: match_on_name
param.label: Match On Name
param.help: Match features using their name instead of their uniquename

param.name: re_name
param.label: Re Name
param.help: Regular expression to extract the feature name from the input file (first capturing group will be used).

param.name: skip_missing
param.label: Skip Missing
param.help: Skip lines with unknown features or GO id instead of aborting everything.

tool.help:
Add an expression matrix file to the database
@HELP@
